subject: Sales
title: The Power of Framing
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Power of Framing.

hook.text: A surgeon says '90% survive.' Another says '10% die.' Same fact. Completely different reactions.

buildup.text: Framing is how you present information. The frame shapes decisions more than the data inside it.

discovery.text: Tversky and Kahneman proved people avoid risk with gains but chase risk when facing losses.

twist.text: Politicians, doctors, and advertisers all frame information. Most don't even realize they're doing it.

climax.text: In sales, frame outcomes as gains for cautious buyers and as loss prevention for bold ones.

punchline.text: Same facts, different frame, different decision.

quiz.question: How does framing affect decisions?
options: It changes how the same facts are perceived
